p: Perilipin 1 is an intracellular protein that covers the lipid droplet surface in adipocytes, regulating TAG storage and mediating stimulated lipolysis ( 13). Higher perilipin activity ( 52) and higher TNF-α levels ( 53) are observed in obesity. TNF-α induces lipolysis mediated by the activation of perilipin 1, promoting its displacement from the lipid droplet, making the TAG molecule more accessible to HSL ( 43).
